item.title: Amy add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Amy add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "All that I hope to say in books, all that I ever hope to say, is that I love the world." -- E.B. White

item.title: Amy add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper, That we may record our emptiness." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Amy add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Amy add a quote by William H. Gass
item.description: "The true alchemists do not change lead into gold; they change the world into words." -- William H. Gass

item.title: Amy add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Amy add a quote by Ted Hughes
item.description: "The only calibration that counts is how much heart people invest, how much they ignore their fears of being hurt or caught out or humiliated. And the only thing people regret is that they didn't live boldly enough, that they didn't invest enough heart, didn't love enough. Nothing else really counts at all." -- Ted Hughes

item.title: Amy add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "Love is an abstract noun, something nebulous. And yet love turns out to be the only part of us that is solid, as the world turns upside down and the screen goes black." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Amy add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I preach there are all kinds of truth, your truth and somebody else's, but behind all of them, there's only one truth and that is that there is no truth... No truth behind all truths is what I and this church preach! Where you come from is gone, where you thought you were going to never was there, and where you are is no good unless you can get away from it. Where is there a place for you to be? No place... In yourself right now is all the place you've got." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Amy add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "The unfed mind devours itself." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Amy add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Amy add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Love blurs your vision; but after it recedes, you can see more clearly than ever. It's like the tide going out, revealing whatever's been thrown away and sunk: broken bottles, old gloves, rusting pop cans, nibbled fishbodies, bones. This is the kind of thing you see if you sit in the darkness with open eyes, not knowing the future." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Amy add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Amy add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "We are always the same age inside. " -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Amy add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "And then I asked him with my eyes to ask again yes and then he asked me would I yes and his heart was going like mad and yes I said yes I will yes." -- James Joyce

item.title: Amy add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Amy add a quote by Louis Adamic
item.description: "My grandfather always said that living is like licking honey off a thorn." -- Louis Adamic

item.title: Amy add a quote by Lawrence Ferlinghetti
item.description: "I am awaiting perpetually and forever a renaissance of wonder" -- Lawrence Ferlinghetti

item.title: Amy add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Amy add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I write to discover what I know." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Amy add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Amy add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "so I wait for you like a lonely house till you will see me again and live in me. Till then my windows ache." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Amy add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "Be clearly aware of the stars and infinity on high. Then life seems almost enchanted after all." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Amy add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "And thus the heart will break, yet brokenly live on." -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Amy add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "and it's you are whatever a moon has always meant and whatever a sun will always sing is you" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Amy add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Amy add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description:
"I carry your heart with me (I carry it in my heart)I am never without it (anywhere I go you go,my dear; and whatever is done by only me is your doing,my darling) I fear no fate (for you are my fate,my sweet)I want no world (for beautiful you are my world,my true) and it's you are whatever a moon has always meant and whatever a sun will always sing is you
here is the deepest secret nobody knows (here is the root of the root and the bud of the bud and the sky of the sky of a tree called life; which grows higher than the soul can hope or mind can hide) and this is the wonder that's keeping the stars apart
I carry your heart (I carry it in my heart)" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Amy add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description:
"let it go -- the smashed word broken open vow or the oath cracked length wise -- let it go it was sworn to go
let them go -- the truthful liars and the false fair friends and the boths and neithers -- you must let them go they were born to go
let all go -- the big small middling tall bigger really the biggest and all things -- let all go dear so comes love" -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Amy add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "And now you are and I am and we're a mystery which will never happen again." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Amy add a quote by e.e cummings
item.description: "Knowledge is a polite word for dead but not buried imagination." -- e.e cummings
